Description: The SEC accused three AXA Rosenberg entities with securities fraud for concealing a significant error in the computer code of the quantitative investment model that they use to manage client assets. The error caused $217 million in investor losses. AXA Rosenberg Group LLC, AXA Rosenberg Investment Management LLC, and Barr Rosenberg Research Center LLC agreed to settle the case by paying $217 million to harmed clients plus a $25 million penalty.
Axa agreed to pay $3.28 million to settle multistate litigation regarding its use of the Social Security Administration's Death Master File.
Info Source: Multimillion Dollar Death Master Settlements Reached, States News Service, December 17, 2015 (via Nexis).

Company: Axa Re Property and Casualty Insurance Co.

Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Info Source: Texas Workers' Comp January Enforcements Include Fines Up to $68K, Insurance Journal, February 15, 2011 (via Nexis).
Texas Workers' Comp May Enforcements Bring More than $70K in Fines, Insurance Journal, June 15, 2011 (via Nexis).

Agency: Rhode Island Department of Business Regulation
